Class FileFormatVerifier

java.lang.Object
  javax.swing.InputVerifier
      edu.umaryland.igs.idea.TextFieldInputVerifier
          edu.umaryland.igs.idea.StateDependentInputVerifier
              edu.umaryland.igs.idea.FileVerifier
                  edu.umaryland.igs.idea.FileFormatVerifier
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Cloneable
Direct Known Subclasses:
DatasetListVerifier, FileAvailabilityVerifier
public abstract class FileFormatVerifier
extends FileVerifier

FileFormatVerifier is an extension of FileVerifier common to text fields which expect the name of a file that must have a particular format. The simplest FileFormatVerifier is FileAvailabilityVerifier, which simply requires that a file exist and be non-empty and readable. Extended classes implement verifyLine to define their own required file formats.

Written:

Copyright (C) 2007, Amy Egan and Joana C. Silva.

All rights reserved.

Author:
Amy Egan

verify

public abstract boolean verify(String line,
                               int lineNumber)
The method verify should return whether or not the line at the given position in the file matches the format expected of it. Subclasses should normally set errorMessage within this method.

Parameters:
line - the line (string) to verify
lineNumber - the number of the line in the file, starting with ONE
Returns:
whether line matches the expected format for the given line number

relativeTo

public String relativeTo()
Although this method is defined here, it may be overridden in subclasses.

Specified by:
relativeTo in class FileVerifier
Returns:
the base path to which entries being validated are assumed to be relative

verifyText

public boolean verifyText(String text)
The verifyText method is declared by TextFieldInputVerifier. FileFormatVerifier's implementation returns false if the entry does not correspond to an existing file if the corresponding file is a directory, unreadable or empty, or if an I/O error occurs while parsing the file. Otherwise, it returns true if every line in the file is found to be valid and false if any line is found to be invalid. Individual lines are validated by calling verify. Since a file may be invalid for a number of distinct reasons, the errorMessage field is set so it can be returned by a later call to errorMessage. Subclasses implementing verify should set errorMessage within that method in the event of failure.

Specified by:
verifyText in class TextFieldInputVerifier
Parameters:
text - the name of a file whose format is to be validated
Returns:
whether the file exists as a readable, non-empty, non-directory file in the required format and can be parsed without an IOException

errorMessage

String errorMessage(String text)
The errorMessage method is declared by TextFieldInputVerifier. FileFormatVerifier's implementation returns a message saved during the validation process indicative of the particular error that occurred or a default error message if a subclass has failed to provide an error message.

Specified by:
errorMessage in class TextFieldInputVerifier
Parameters:
text - the name of the file which was found not to be in the required format
Returns:
an error message explaining the particular formatting or I/O error
